TITLE: Ten people killed in Paris building blaze, foul play suspected
SUMMARY: At least 10 people have died after a blaze swept through an apartment block in central Paris in the middle of the night, Paris prosecutor Remy Heitz said early Tuesday, adding that the fire may have been started maliciously.

TITLE: To live your best life, live the life you evolved for
SUMMARY: When we adopt a pet, we learn about their normal environment, activity level and nutrition. Isn't it interesting that we do not apply that to the animal we live in? To feel normal, we should live normal, and a human's normal life is that for which she or he has evolved.

TITLE: Climate change will melt vast parts of the Himalayas, study says
SUMMARY: Climate change will melt a third of the ice in the Himalayas even if the goals of the Paris climate agreement are met, a new report finds. And that's a serious threat to the 240 million people who live in the Hindu Kush Himalaya region and the 3 billion who rely on food produced in the area.

TITLE: GOP senators express concerns about a national emergency declaration to fund border wall
SUMMARY: Several senior Senate Republicans and members of GOP leadership raised serious concerns Monday about the possibility of President Donald Trump bypassing Congress and using an emergency declaration to build a border wall with Mexico.

TITLE: Ocasio-Cortez invites activist who confronted Jeff Flake over Kavanaugh nomination as State of the Union guest
SUMMARY: Democratic Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez of New York has invited Ana Maria Archila to be her guest at President Donald Trump's State of the Union address.

TITLE: Former Bond King Bill Gross is retiring
SUMMARY: Legendary investor Bill Gross, the onetime king of the bond market, announced plans on Monday to retire after more than four decades in finance.

TITLE: Gannett rejects takeover bid by hedge fund-owned Digital First Media
SUMMARY: Gannett, the nation's largest newspaper chain and the publisher of USA Today, rejected a takeover bid by MNG Enterprises, the hedge fund-owned company also known as Digital First Media, on Monday.

TITLE: IUD insertions went up after Trump's election, research shows
SUMMARY: The daily rate of long-acting reversible contraceptive insertions increased 21.6% in the 30 days after Donald Trump was elected president, compared with the 30 days before, according to new research.

TITLE: Power restored at Brooklyn detention center where inmates had been sitting in the cold
SUMMARY: Power has been restored at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, New York, where inmates spent several days without heat or lighting, according to a statement from the Bureau of Prisons.

TITLE: ASMR has been around for almost a decade, but you probably hadn't heard of it before this Super Bowl ad
SUMMARY: What is AMSR -- an explanation.

TITLE: Papa John's gets a $200 million investment and new chairman
SUMMARY: Papa John's has a plan to turn itself around with new board members and a big check.

TITLE: 20,000 homes at risk in Australia floods as crocodiles, snakes wash up
SUMMARY: Devastating flooding in northeast Australia has forced thousands of people from their homes and brought snakes and crocodiles onto the streets as authorities warn of strong winds and more rain on the way.

TITLE: A teen is accused of vandalizing a Hindu temple with spray-painted crosses and religious phrases
SUMMARY: A Louisville teen has been arrested and charged with vandalizing a Hindu temple in Louisville earlier this week, police said.

TITLE: The Patriots' latest Super Bowl challenger is the Rams, in a 2002 Super Bowl rematch
SUMMARY: The Patriots dynasty began in 2002, when a plucky team led by a 49-year-old head coach named Bill Belichick and 24-year-old quarterback Tom Brady upset the Rams in Super Bowl XXXVI.

TITLE: The Super Bowl ads you will remember
SUMMARY: Kara Alaimo writes that the Super Bowl ads likely to resonate the most are the ones for brands that don't just peddle products, but also send powerful messages about issues that are top of mind for many Americans.

TITLE: 'El Chapo' Guzman accused in court documents of having sex with young girls
SUMMARY: Witnesses in the case against Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman told authorities the drug lord had sex with young girls he called "vitamins" that gave him "life," according to court documents unsealed late Friday.

TITLE: The biggest moments from the Super Bowl
SUMMARY: From the scene on the streets to the commercials to the halftime show, here are live updates from today's Super Bowl in Atlanta.

TITLE: Where you can stream the Super Bowl
SUMMARY: The entire NFL season will come down to Super Bowl LIII on Sunday, Feb. 3. Luckily, it's easier than ever to stream the big game and watch the Patriots face off against the Rams.

TITLE: Deputy killed during 12-hour Ohio standoff with suicidal man, police say
SUMMARY: It began with a bizarre call to 911, police say. It ended about 12 hours later with an Ohio deputy dead, another injured and a suspect in custody.

TITLE: Trump says use of military force in Venezuela is still on the table
SUMMARY: President Donald Trump said that the use of US military force in Venezuela is still on the table amid its ongoing political crisis and that he turned down a meeting with Venezuelan President Nicol√°s Maduro several months ago.

TITLE: McAuliffe predicts Northam 'will do the right thing'
SUMMARY: Former Virginia Democratic Gov. Terry McAuliffe said Sunday he believes Gov. Ralph Northam will resign soon amid wide-ranging calls for his former lieutenant to step down.

TITLE: House Democrats have new power. They still face a fight over Trump's tax returns
SUMMARY: Democrats have control of the House, but that may not be enough to get them one thing they really want: access to President Donald Trump's tax returns.

TITLE: America, don't abandon Afghanistan again
SUMMARY: The Trump administration is closer to making a peace deal with the Taliban that could lead to the sudden withdrawal of US troops, which could become another example of the US abandoning Afghanistan completely, write Abdul Rahman Rahmani and Jason Criss Howk.

TITLE: Our politicians should be allowed to evolve
SUMMARY: Dean Obeidallah writes that while it's clear that Gov. Ralph Northam should step down as governor, it doesn't mean that he and others like him should not be encouraged to broaden and change their minds.

TITLE: Inmates without power at New York federal prison shivering in their cells for days
SUMMARY: Many inmates at the federal detention center in the New York borough of Brooklyn were still sitting in their cold and dark cells Saturday because of a partial power outage, the director of Federal Defenders of New York David Patton and a representative for the union representing the facility's workers said.

TITLE: Brazil's Brumadinho dam was certified 'stable' weeks before it collapsed
SUMMARY: In just over three years, two dams have collapsed in the same Brazilian state, leaving thousands of families in mourning. This time, some Brazilians say they fear that the country's monitoring system is deeply flawed.

TITLE: Here's who has called for Ralph Northam's resignation
SUMMARY: Virginia Democratic Gov. Ralph Northam on Saturday rejected calls to step down following controversy involving a racist photo from his yearbook.

TITLE: Utah GOP lawmakers move to limit voter-approved Medicaid expansion
SUMMARY: Utah voters approved Medicaid expansion last November, but Republican state representatives -- who have long opposed broadening coverage for low-income residents -- are now moving to limit the extent of the changes.

TITLE: These eco-friendly sneakers may be the comfiest shoes you'll ever own
SUMMARY: Allbirds sneakers, which have been dubbed "the world's most comfortable shoe," live up to the claim.
